website_summaries.verdict: The Trendnet TEW-639GR Wireless N Gigabit Router  is a decent investment for Wireless-N home networking, offering a decent package at an affordable price.
pros: The Trendnet TEW-639GR Wireless N Gigabit Router has good throughput performance, an easy-to-use Web interface, support for Gigabit Ethernet, and a comprehensive set of home networking features
cons: The Trendnet TEW-639GR Wireless N Gigabit Router lacks high-end features, such as support for a USB device, dual-band wireless networking, and guest networking
Also, its range and wireless connection stability could be better

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a reliable router for broadband!
customer_reviews.text: I've been a Linksys user for a long time, but have been starting to feel like their product quality has been dropping while their prices haven't! Paired with driver problems with their wireless adapters and two routers failing on me, I decided it was time for a change. Enter the Trendnet TEW-639GR. This router had extremely easy setup, and 100% uptime since I installed it about a year ago. Software configuration is simple, and it has been compatible with every wireless product I've connected to it. No problems are good problems, what else can I say (and the price was right too). Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Camera Guy

customer_reviews.title: Horrible router, save your money
customer_reviews.text: I am actually a big fan of TrendNet gear, and all the gigabit switches in my house are their GREENnet series. So I didn't think twice about buying this router especially for the price. However, this router was awful. It would not keep my internet connection alive, random drops all the time that would require a router reboot. The wireless signal was not very good either, my older D-Link DI-524 802.11g Access Point provided much better coverage throughout my house (2-stories with 40x40 footprint). Returned this router (gotta give props to TigerDirect for 100% refund) and bought a D-Link DIR-655 XtremeN which has been so much better. Very disappointed in this router, I do not recommend that you buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Rhee

customer_reviews.title: Trend net 300 tew-639gr from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 6 of these routers in recent months for clients and friends. I found the setup to be simple, the router works well and I have no complaints from anyone at all. That fullfills my needs and clients needs also. I have had no reason to call tech support so I think that is a good thing. 4 out of 6 of my clients stream video thru a roku and use a playstation or other video device. No setup problems or usage problems there either. I will continue to order this product for others as well as myself if needed. As usual ordering and delivery from Amazon was easy and quick, I expect nothing else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good router for advance users.
customer_reviews.text: It is now 3 year old. The interface is bizzare, but works VERY well. At this time, look for AC as (B G N) are phasing out. AC can provide up to 1GHZ but your adapter must support that standard. Still a good buy moving forward past 2014 AC will be the standard for all new WIFI. Overall router is a 3 and needs an advance user to fully understand the interface. :) MCSE, CCNA, <<< Advanced.
customer_reviews.author: L. Truitt

customer_reviews.title: TrendNet quality
customer_reviews.text: Always have had a good experience with their products. The last router lasted 8 years. If you have one for that long you should upgrade regardless if it breaks or not.
customer_reviews.author: Albert G.

customer_reviews.title: Good bang and range for the buck-becomes less reliable with age
customer_reviews.text: This is a good value for the price. It provides improved range compared to an early Belkin N router it replaced. Set up was "relatively" easy and straight forward. The default settings are set up for the most common internet connection. The security feature is, however, defaulted off. This is the only stumbling block I had. None of my five wifi devices could connect when I selected the WPA security. I then downgraded to WEP security and was successful with all of them. UPDATE: After a year of use, it began requiring multiple resets each day to continue operations. Installing the latest firmware at tech supports recommendation did not improve the reliability
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Nice wi-fi router!
customer_reviews.text: Like all the administrative options it offers. Works fine & offers a reliable wi-fi connection. Never really had any constant disconnect issues like you may have with other wi-fi routers. WPA2 + AES or TKIP help maintain some security along with mac address filtering.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Solid and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Solid product, works well and is reliable. Have installed in multiple environments and have no complains on its performance and range. Can set it up either as a router or as an AP. I would have preferred a few more features and flexibility with configuration especially as those relate to routing and security, but for the price I would just buy a few more!
customer_reviews.author: buy2use

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: The unit works well. I had to call support as I had one faulty unit. They told me few things that are not documented (like power cycle after holding the reset button for 20sec, to really get the factory default to happen right). Overall very good value for the price. Got 1Gig Ether, the wireless works well too. Configuration is just like most other units - relatively transparent and logical.
customer_reviews.author: Grzegorz Tokarski

customer_reviews.title: Returned Merchandise a breeze
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a TrendNet TEW-639GR router, for whatever reason, i couldn't connect to the router. Returning this product was a breeze. Submit a request and UPS picked it up the next day. Welcome to the 'virtual' age of customer service, it couldn't be easier. I ended up ordering a newer model, it's working great. Great prices, Great returns, Greatly satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: ACHA

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE has to be reset every few hours
customer_reviews.text: This router was sketchy to start with, it would run for nearly a day, then it would need to be unplugged and plugged back in to get a connection. Then it slowly got worse, but I kept blaming my internet provider. Once I finally got them out here they proved it was my router, tried to send it back, but was past my 10 minute return period. MICKEY MOUSE JUNK! Stay away from this! Or good luck if you actually get one that works.........
customer_reviews.author: Joe D. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this less than 4 months ago. I've been testing it with everything from cell phones to 3 different laptops. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. I'll accept that a wirelss N router sometimes doesn't broadcast in the proper channel for cell phones, but not for a new Macbook Air, HP Laptop & Dell Laptop. The wired router works but the wireless constantly drops. Unfortunately I'm out of the first month return policy, so I'm stuck with a broken router.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey H. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Nice and fast
customer_reviews.text: I wanted stronger wireless coverage and a gigabit router for my network- this does it. I have not had any significant issues at all. Just the very rare mysterious 'not connecting', which a quick reset solves (cable company??). The only 'negative' is I had wanted to use larger antennas, but these are not removable. It does the job.
customer_reviews.author: JimIn Raleigh

customer_reviews.title: TrendNet all the way.
customer_reviews.text: I am a long-time fan of TrendNet products. This router is 6 years old and still working great. I just bought a new TrendNet router and will continue to use this older one as an additional access point & switch.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Moody

customer_reviews.title: Okay router
customer_reviews.text: WORKS GREAT; except cannot use wireless on my computers; around heavy walls and signal is too weak; table and phone work in living room where router is; ran cables to both computers and removed wireless receiver cards.
customer_reviews.author: Sober Poster

customer_reviews.title: Quick & Easy
customer_reviews.text: Bought for son's apartment to replace an old G Linksys router. Placement was a challenge as only usable location was bottom shelf of a book case. I need to experiment remotely trying to get better coverage in apartment. Product was very easy to set-up and configure.
customer_reviews.author: PaRAJ

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for G wireless router
customer_reviews.text: Easy to configure. Have better connectivity to a 'g' device than with previous 'g' only access point. Good 'n' connectivity as well. It was a bit difficult to set up connectivity through the router to devices on the wireless, but it is doable. Wish it had SNMP capability for better monitoring.
customer_reviews.author: Richard O.

customer_reviews.title: We use them for accounting field work
customer_reviews.text: These units were easy to set up & easy to cost-justify. We have them in our "field kits" so that our auditors can have multiple wired-Gig connections or wireless "n" connections at the client's sites. They're working fine so far...
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: but the range is excellent. Probably going to upgrade the firmware
customer_reviews.text: This this is weird, doesn't work very well for phones, but the range is excellent. Probably going to upgrade the firmware, get rid of the 'green' s***. Makes it pretty weak.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Setup and Running in a flash!
customer_reviews.text: I had a wireless router for 4 years and it expired recently. I bought this little beauty due to its positive reviews. The thing was pretty easy to setup. I received the device at 12 PM and had 12 machines connecting to it within an hour (8 PCs, XBox 360, 3 WP7 Phones). The only bad bit is that of my devices, 1 needed to be setup to find the SSID for the router as it couldn't see the broadcast SSID. The bad part there- that one device uses TRENDnet 802.11n card. No big deal though-- the card connected fine and is communicating with the router as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a excellent product so far, it is faster than my former dlink product.I did experience a little problem with the installation but had a computer repair man in for another project so he insalled it with out using the disc which is what was causing my issue.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: I've had many problems with wireless routers over the years, and this is the first router I've gotten that I've had little/no problems with. Very likely I will purchase from them again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Good Wireless Rounter For the Money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this router because my NetGear one didn't seem to send a very strong signal. This one is much better, but don't get nearly the distance out of it that is shown in the specs. Probably has a lot to do with the fact that it's located on the second floor of our house and we use most of the wireless devises on the first floor. Very easy to hook up, and get in operation. Price/Value is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Al C.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap works great
customer_reviews.text: Cheap works great, gigabit ethernet ports really speed up intranet file transfers. Should speed up your whole Internet experience so long as you have a fast connection.
customer_reviews.author: R. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to set up, but the area of signal it seems, has diminished over time, which is odd I know. But it works and seems as though it's faster than most routers I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: A good router for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent router with good range, but following any power or cable blip it has to be rebooted. Other than that irritation, it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy, super fast, good features
customer_reviews.text: I am not a tech-head but have been through many routers in the past. This one was by far the easiest to set up, and it's easy to manage, too. The push-button security option I still can't get to work with my BlackBerry, for some reason, but I'm pretty sure that's me missing something and not caring enough to troubleshoot and not the fault of the router. My laptop is N wireless enabled, but the connection seems to work really well for iPhones, too. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: The router was pretty straight forward to setup. I have an iMac and I was able to easily get into the router interface. My only complaint is that I bought this to extend the range of wireless into my basement. I only saw marginal improvement over my old Linksys 54g router. I feel I'm going to have to purchase an extender to get coverage into my basement.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: TEW-639GR--What a disappointment!! Get the older version TEW-633-GR instead!!!
customer_reviews.text: "You get what you pay for." I thought that this router would be a logical (and less expensive) replacement for my 4 year old TEW-633gr router. Unfortunately the 639gr dropped connections several times each hour, the WPS button only worked one time, it was difficult to connect with my other wireless devices, and it had far fewer features/diagnostic options than the 633gr. It was not worth the lower price and the hassle. I returned it. I STRONGLY RECOMMEND BUYING THE OLDER VERSION TEW-633gr MODEL--a good used one is an excellect buy for a great router.
customer_reviews.author: KenZen

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Fourth time I buy this product, for use in home and small office. So far every single item has been working flawlessly and the one just purchased is working as expected. Good speed, good performance with multiple users streaming and skype with video, easy set-up and security options. Definitely like not to broadcast the SSID. Would definitely buy it again if I need another one.
customer_reviews.author: Pertinent

customer_reviews.title: Worked well at first ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked flawlessly for about a year then the wired LAN ports started to fail. At first they would drop connection intermittently, then they failed outright along with the WAN port rendering the unit useless. Attempting to get a replacement through the manufacturer's RMA process at the moment. The WLAN range was quite good while the unit worked.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Jaworski

customer_reviews.title: Works as good as my current Trendnet
customer_reviews.text: Works as good as my current Trendnet. I need to have two routers at two different places and both works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: eappan

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Others I've Used
customer_reviews.text: This is my second TRENDnet router (kids took my older one). This newer model looks great and works perfect. One option that I really like it being able to turn off the transmitter if I just want to use it wired. I've read some reviews that say this unit doesn't meet the advertised specs.......if it doesn't, it is so minuscule that it doesn't make any difference. It is easy to set-up, works well and is fast.
customer_reviews.author: GMAN

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a new router.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a while, but now constantly drops my connection.
customer_reviews.author: P3

customer_reviews.title: New old stock...
customer_reviews.text: The unit is a good router, however, the unit had to have the software updated to get it to function...... although new, the unit was over a year and a half old.... (I spent over an hour talking to a Trendnet technician in India before the unit functioned properly!)
customer_reviews.author: winger2000se

customer_reviews.title: powerful router
customer_reviews.text: I got this router 2 days ago and we have connected to it, 2 galaxy s 3, a galaxy note 2, nexus 7 tablet , a xbox 360 and a macbook all at once and it runs flawlessly. Great buy for the money
customer_reviews.author: lueevoutin

customer_reviews.title: Best router I have owned to date
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several other brands of wireless routers, the big names, and this is by far my favorite to date. Setup is easy and simple. Performance is great, I had no problems playing a MMORPG while my kids enjoyed a netflix movie streamed over the internet to my TV. Glad I chose this router over other brands. If I have any issues with range or overheating as I have read about in other brand reviews I will update the post.
customer_reviews.author: HJLII

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The range was not as i expected compared to the one from the cable company.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest R Derrico

customer_reviews.title: Easy and great
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. I had no problem with setting it up within 15 minutes. It is easy to set the security settings for the wireless portion. Definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.author: LawSchoolHopeful

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the money
customer_reviews.text: A little hard to set up... 3 years later it decided it wanted to die.
customer_reviews.author: ChaseM

customer_reviews.title: One of the best deals in Wi-fi as of 2010!
customer_reviews.text: If you're nervous about this brand don't be, it consistently ranks highly here and on Newegg.com. I found this product reliable, space efficient, and highly configurable. Installation was a breeze, and the tech support really is 24hr! I have never had to reset this router since installation which is amazing considering how many times it gets unplugged momentarily and used for informal networking. The set up is actually Easier that a same generation Netgear router I had before. This does a great job of handling simultaneous downloads, uploads, and live streaming over several wireless G and N laptops in my apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Trendynet!

customer_reviews.title: This is what i've been looking for
customer_reviews.text: Best N wireless router I have ever had. Strong signal, stay connected, and very reliable. The setup is also easy especially for an inexperience user like me. I have bought this item for a month and still no reset need. Previously, I had used three wireless router and none of them works great like this, as they needed reset from time to time and can't stay connected for more than a day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Instructions incomplete (for me at least)
customer_reviews.text: I actually sent the first one back, second acted the same. Customer support had me "Clone MAC" and I was able to use it. I still have not figured out how to secure my connection properly! Amazon gets 5 Stars for working with me also!
customer_reviews.author: RandyK

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly but the instructions were to difficult to understand, I had to higher some one to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup - Fast Page loading WIFI
customer_reviews.text: Great Price!, Super Fast 2 day shipping, Runs Cool and FAST, and Security was easy to set up. It has the power to reach my neighbor down the street, I just typed my Security password on his computer wifi program and he is good to go. There is a very noticeble increase in page downloading speed from my Lynsky g speed WIFI.
customer_reviews.author: tomnchrist

customer_reviews.title: really really fast :) router
customer_reviews.text: no problems setting it up. performance is great so far. had it about one month now. using it for a small business running about 8 wireless PC's
customer_reviews.author: rlg1

customer_reviews.title: average
customer_reviews.text: Good router just not big enough for my house and needs.
customer_reviews.author: the icon

customer_reviews.title: Not good - Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a wireless G router and was expecting more than this from N. It is faster, but not as fast as what I wanted. Speeds range from 77 to 144. I would be somewhat happy with 144 if it stayed there all the time, but it is almost never at that speed. It is mostly jumping between 77, 117 and 130. There is nothing in the way and the connection is secured so no one is stealing it from me. All in all I have to say just so-so. Probably not this router, but rather N routers in general unless you go for the 600 speed dual band router.
customer_reviews.author: J. Willey

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Good Product. Strong signal. Does not need reboots. No Dropouts. Enough choices in the in-built menu system, including channel selection. Wish it had more elaborate Qos and was DD-Wrt compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Quant

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have used trendinet with much success and this was as always dependable as still going
customer_reviews.author: wayno

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I've had a trendnet wired router for 7-8 years & it always worked perfectly. I bought a Belkin router to add wireless & had nothing but trouble, so I went back to the trendnet & it couldn't be better. Gigabit wired connections work fantastically, the wireless was easy to setup with a multitude of security options. Much better setup utility than the Belkin. Works great wirelessly with a mac-book, an old pc laptop and wired with 2 vista machines, 2 xp machines & an HD-Homerun. I still have the belkin router connected as an ethernet switch only (wireless off & DHCP off) for 2 machines with only 10/100 capability. Now I need an n adapter for the old laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: I use this unit for my DSL (AT&T). No speed difference from old unit to this one. The set up book seems to be missing some instructions but I called tech and they were very helpful. After a month of use it seems to be working fine. The price was under 50 bucks and that was great.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Terrible technical support on an unreliable product
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy a product where the technical support eats up hours of time without results. Obviously some products are clunkers but Trendnet technical support just wastes your time. I was having slow connections and the technical support person ran through massive numbers of hacks in the backend with a result of even slower connections. An hour later, all he could say was he'd have some one else call me back maybe two days from now. Just pathetically bad support.
customer_reviews.author: N. Newman

customer_reviews.title: Bad router
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about a month and then consantly would drop my wan connection, had nothing to do with the wireless (it was off). The wan port would just arbitrarily drop the connection and take a good 2-3 minutes to reconnect. It happened while surfing and sometimes while idle. Switched my gateway back to my old linksys and i've had 0 issues since.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good router
customer_reviews.text: I recently got this to replace my linksys, I've gone through 2 Linksys, They're so unstable. So far the trendnet hasn't given me any problems, Although when the router arrived, The AC adapter came defective. It wouldn't turn on so I tried my linksys AC adapter and it turned on, I tried shaking it trendnets AC and you could hear something was broken inside, I was going to RMA it, But I'll just keep linksys power adapter. +1 Trendnet router/Linksys AC -1 Trendnet AC/Linksys router hehe.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this router.
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty happy with this router. I have setup the security to WPA2 and set wireless to only broadcast in N exclusively. To get up to 110 mbps I also had to make sure it broadcasts in 40mghz and not 20, and upgrade my old desktop with a USB Trendnet N card.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should
customer_reviews.text: Works like it should. I've got two desktops hooked up, plus the laser printer and a laptop wirelessly. Everything is working flawlessly. You just need to follow the directions for setup, and keep in mind that when you first set up the router, you need to turn everything off, then plug in the computers and the router to the modem, then turn on the modem, then the router, and finally the computers. Wait 2 minutes between each of those startups. Once done, you never have to do that again. Very happy with the equipment!
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: High hopes quickly dashed
customer_reviews.text: I have an old Bilken router and thought it was time to upgrade. The reviews were good and the price was right so I bought this one. Every time two computers or a game system and computer are on one lags out and I'm kicked off the Internet. I've tried resetting and reinstalling but still no luck. When only one machine is on it is fine but if you plan on multiple machines at once, I would pass on this.
customer_reviews.author: OU812

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy to set up!
customer_reviews.text: Easy set-up and fast wi-fi! The quick set-up guide was easy to understand and the unit worked just as advertised with the iPad G3 and my wife's old iTouch G2 and her laptop. She can now play Farmville without glitches... :P
customer_reviews.author: Apex Audio, Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Good and Bad
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first just had a double NAT problem. Suddenly the WPS light lit, and the unit locked up, stopped transmitting the WiFi signal, and acted as a simple switch. Contacted TrendNet Help Desk, and submitted a ticket in the hopes they can help.
customer_reviews.author: Old_Sarge

customer_reviews.title: good and compact device
customer_reviews.text: good and compact device, I use it for home media network between NAS and DLNA TV, gigbit option reduce seek speed (against 100 mbit switch). Good compatibility with win 7 via wireless adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Andrey Tuchak

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job with the right N adaptor
customer_reviews.text: Not the best installation instructions, but after a call to customer service (very polite and helpfull), it worked fine. My laptop speed with a Linksys adaptor, increased from 54 mbps to 103.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: 10 Months Later, Quite Satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine in Jan 2012. Now, it's October and I don't think I have to reset it more than once a month. Good enough, when one considers that I used a Belkin F5D8235-4 Wireless Trash Can Filler for a year before that. Do me a favor: Don't buy one. I want to be able to buy another one when the one I use now finally croaks. There aren't very many left. Thank you, in advance.
customer_reviews.author: D. Madigan

customer_reviews.title: Works fine.
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing spectacular about this router. Setup was straightforward enough, does what it's supposed to. Gigabit LAN ports are nice for local transfers. Wireless seems stable.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: wow
customer_reviews.text: one of the best if not hte best wireless router Ive ever used it never if ever rarely crashess maintains high speeds
customer_reviews.author: dre

customer_reviews.title: good router
customer_reviews.text: Good router for the money. average performance and easy setup. Previous Tendnet products have given good service but this is brand new so no reliability info yet
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Just another Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to try to increase the distance of my wireless signal. The router was easy to set up and seemed to work just like my linksys router. But I did return this router because the signal was no better than my older "G" router. It was touted to be better and would increase my signal. It did not.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene J. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless router I have used.
customer_reviews.text: Best wireless router I have used and this is my fifth. I have tried Linksys, D-link, and Zyxel. This was the easiest to set up and I have not had to reboot it in the weeks that I have had it. Addtionally, it is strong enough to stream Netflix on my TV which is about 40" and two walls away. I have purchased many items from Amazon and have always been impressed with their service.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Great router for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, installed without a problem. Works fine on both my WIN 7, N laptop and my LINUX/UBUNTU 9.1, G laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L

customer_reviews.title: Red  Light  Review
customer_reviews.text: I have uses trendnet before...very nice reliable product. I just purchased the tew639gr (router) and it was somewhat confusing. I would like some feedback on it. I called trendnet support and the lady told me it was normal..............maybe it is. When the lan (pc's) are connected the lan lights are red and when the pc is off they are green. Backwards I thought. I had a tcp/ip problem and my pc would not work........thought it was the router with its red lights????
customer_reviews.author: James E. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied, I like this Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: This one is definetly better than any other brand, I had linksys, netgear and D-link before, never got one like this stable and easy to use. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: J. HAO Cheng

customer_reviews.title: double speed
customer_reviews.text: As i have owned only one TRENDnet wireless router before i do not have massive experience with them. But I as a rookie have realized what a true good router should preform like. This router has doubled my speed on the internet through wireless and wired connections. It was very easy to set up following the 1-2-3 set up guide, it took 10 minutes to get it running. It has proved to preform better than my previous routers undoubtedly. No drawbacks so far. It's been 1 month
customer_reviews.author: VanBrad

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Got the router in the mail and in 30 minutes had it up and running, no problems at all. Have not had any problems yet so no need to talk to tec support for this item, but i gave them 5 stars anyways. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Himebaugh

customer_reviews.title: Fast & stable!!!
customer_reviews.text: This router has been very good to me.i have never lost a connection,ever! i have multiple devices running at the same time both wireless & gigabit.i have the ps3 using the wired gigabit port (no N-wireless on the ps3).i can download whole games in just a couple of minutes. tv,ps3,360,wii,desktop & laptop all on the network.from netflix to pandora to online games all smooth no juddder,no loss in connection.in short: fast,stable,reliable & affordable!!
customer_reviews.author: redsi322

customer_reviews.title: Great, reliable, easy device
customer_reviews.text: I had an old wireless modem that was continually dropping our signal. I would constantly have to unplug the modem and plug it back in to get a new signal. The Trednet 300 was easy to set up, has great distance and does not drop the signal- ever! I have already suggested it to family because of it's great price!
customer_reviews.author: Trouthappy

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: What more is there to say about this router other than it was very simple to setup out of the box, has great signal range, and is probably one of the least expensive 1Gb routers on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Louis T. Paris Jr.

customer_reviews.title: fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: this product ships fast it is so easy to set up and is awesome it moves so fast i just love it cant find anything wrong with it
customer_reviews.author: rachel

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works Great. Pros - works great cons - a little complicated to get started. I'm good at this stuff and I had a tough time to get through it but by no means let this deter you from buying this. Works too good to worry about it setting it up.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Larocco

customer_reviews.title: No problems in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: It works great and does what it's supposed to do. Have not had any problems
customer_reviews.author: Reviewing For Fun

customer_reviews.title: Works well - no problems
customer_reviews.text: Have been using for a month or so now. Took a couple minutes to set up and since then it has worked well both for wired and wireless computers. I have not had to reset the router once. Actually haven't thought about the router at all, which is the way it should be.
customer_reviews.author: T. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: BEST ROUTER I'VE EVER PURCHASED
customer_reviews.text: Great router! the speeds are as advertised and the price is great!. This is my first time purchasing any product from Trendnet after being a loyal Lynksys and D-Link fan. I figured for the price and the specs I couldn't go wrong. I was surprised how durable and stable this router is. The Admin page is a bit cheesy and looks like someone just threw it together.. but it works and i'm VERY satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: r0ck3tstar

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: Other than struggling with initial setup instuctions, probably since this is my first router, I have been extremely satisfied with the Trendnet TEW-639GR wireless router. Streams movies very well all through the house, great signal strenght. I would recommend this router based on its performance so far.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Reliable....
customer_reviews.text: You can say this item is reliable, 300 MB/s, maybe if you keep your laptop sticked on the router. Do not believe all it has in description(technical description). I will try something different.
customer_reviews.author: dinut79

customer_reviews.title: Good Router
customer_reviews.text: The set-up was nonexistent; I just plugged it in and was connected to the internet. In three weeks of using it, I have not had any dropped connections. Its wireless coverage and speed is consistently strong throughout my two-story house. The wireless speed is good. This router is perfect for standard, everyday, home usage.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Work in Xbox 360 S and PS3 Slim
customer_reviews.text: This router work great in 3 laptops my PS3 Slim, my Xbox S and Wii. Is very easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Juan del Pueblo

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Set up is easy. Strength of single seems good. Speed is good. Everything seems to work except. The wireless connection continuously breaks randomly. Very annoying. Didn't have time to return :(
customer_reviews.author: mshopper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router.. have not had to reset since installing. Bought this one because I had bought one for my parents that is still on its first power up, 8 months later. stable, good range, easy set up. A good product.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle B. Chilcoat

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because my older wireless router cannot reach one room in the basement. This product can reach beyond a 1-foot cement wall in the basement just fine. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Kingsum Chow

customer_reviews.title: good for gigabit connection within home network, but not much else.
customer_reviews.text: got this so i could speed up the network in my home, but i didnt know it would be at the expense of other things. using this router, my overall internet connectivity suffered, web pages loading slower. and i couldnt get wireless g to work even after setting it up in the admin system.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Ian Staker

customer_reviews.title: Does not extend range
customer_reviews.text: This product does not extend range nor signal strength. Easy to set up and it continues to run without a problem. It just does not function as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Not Happy

customer_reviews.title: Extremely satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Belkin with this unit and have not had the first problem in three months. I used to have to reset the belkin regularly. I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Works spoadically
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit because I had hoped for a better range for Wi Fi from my office upstairs to my Rec room for PC and Wi Fi enabled Ps3 system. Unfortunately I have wasted my money on this unit as the range has not improved over my Belkin N router which I have hooked back up. [...]
customer_reviews.author: Zman

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about a month. Speed is good. No drops, works good with my work vpn connection. Good range too.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J. Fussy

customer_reviews.title: router without removable antenna
customer_reviews.text: Good router but really wanted a device with removable antenna for better antenna reception.Guess my neighbors will have to put usb type antenna on their computers instead.
customer_reviews.author: RevEddie012

customer_reviews.title: not really mac compatible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it said it would work with a mac. It doesn't. They are giving me a gift card which is something but they didn't give me back my money which would have been the right thing to do. I suggest if you want a router that you buy it locally where you can return it more easily for a full refund if it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Beth

customer_reviews.title: Drops internet CONSTANTLY
customer_reviews.text: I'm stuck with this thing because I thought it worked & I threw out the box, but as others have said, this thing drops the internet many times per day. I'm talking a hundred times a day. Not just wireless, but wired connections too. Save your money. This should really be pulled from the market.
customer_reviews.author: Str8Talk

product_meta.title: TRENDnet N300 Wireless Gigabit Router, TEW-639GR
feature_bullets: Seamlessly stream video, download files, talk online and play games
Features one-touch Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS) and manual wireless on / off switch
Advanced wireless encryption and a firewall provides robust security
